intro: Navarretia atractyloides, commonly known as the silverleaf larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in open, sunny habitats. Its leaves are basal, forming a rosette, and the flowers are borne on slender stems. Navarretia atractyloides is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to coastal climates with mild, wet winters and dry summers.
